name: Collision with School Bus Liability and Damage Coverage
description: Comprehensive protection for incidents involving collisions with school buses, addressing public safety and financial liability. Coverage includes medical expenses for passengers, property damage to the school bus, and potential legal expenses arising from the incident. Special provisions mandate immediate reporting to both local law enforcement and the school district, with additional coverage for psychological counseling for involved parties, particularly minors. Claim processing requires detailed accident scene documentation, including witness statements, police reports, and photographic evidence of vehicle damage and bus impact zones.
keyProvisions: Property damage to school bus protection

immediate: Log first notice of loss in claims system with school bus flag
Contact insured driver to verify injuries and obtain recorded statement
Call school district risk manager to coordinate response and media
Set initial reserves: $150K bodily injury per child, $75K property damage
Email school bus incident alert to supervisor and legal team
within24Hours: Order medical records for all passengers through vendor portal
Schedule vehicle inspection with preferred auto damage appraiser
Request school bus maintenance records and driver qualification file
Send reservation of rights letter to insured if coverage questions exist
Update claim notes with preliminary liability assessment in system
within72Hours: Review police report and upload to claim file imaging system
Contact plaintiff attorneys if any children have legal representation
Coordinate with school district's insurance carrier on shared liability
Adjust reserves based on medical reports and treatment plans received
Schedule strategy call with supervisor if serious injuries confirmed

documentationRequired: Medical reports for all injured parties

actions: Verify no hidden injuries with medical professional
Immediate medical assessment for all passengers

name: Adverse Weather Damage Coverage
description: This policy extends protection for vehicular damage sustained during severe weather events, including but not limited to hailstorms, flooding, and tornado-related incidents. Comprehensive coverage will apply to repairs necessitated by natural disaster-related damage, with a special provision that waives the standard deductible if the vehicle was parked in a designated shelter or garage at the time of the incident.

immediate: Check NOAA weather database to confirm storm in area at loss time
Review insured's garage/shelter documentation for deductible waiver eligibility
Set comprehensive coverage reserves based on preliminary damage photos
Contact preferred DRP (Direct Repair Program) shops for inspection availability
Flag claim as CAT (catastrophe) if part of larger weather event
within24Hours: Order official weather report from certified meteorologist if claim contested
Upload photos to estimate writing software and generate preliminary estimate
Contact rental car vendor to arrange transportation if vehicle not drivable
Review policy for any weather-related endorsements or exclusions
Update claim status to 'under investigation' if deductible waiver disputed
within72Hours: Complete final damage estimate and supplement if additional damage found
Process deductible waiver in system if shelter documentation confirmed
Issue payment less deductible or arrange direct payment to repair facility
Close claim file if total loss or repair authorization provided
Update reserves to zero if claim settled within authority limits

keyProvisions: Waived standard deductible if vehicle parked in designated shelter

name: Multi-Vehicle Pile-Up and Complex Collision Scenario
description: Coverage specifically designed for complex accident scenarios involving three or more vehicles, where determining fault is intricate. The policy provides comprehensive protection that covers medical expenses, vehicle repairs, and potential legal representation. Special emphasis is placed on forensic accident reconstruction, with provisions for independent investigation to fairly allocate liability. Additional benefits include temporary vehicle replacement and coverage for indirect damages such as lost wages and rehabilitation costs.

immediate: Create complex loss file in claims system with multi-vehicle flag
Establish contact with all other insurance carriers and claim numbers
Set high reserves per vehicle: $100K BI, $25K PD pending investigation
Contact SIU (Special Investigation Unit) if fraud indicators present
Notify excess carrier if potential for policy limits exposure
within24Hours: Retain accident reconstruction expert from approved vendor list
Obtain recorded statements from insured and any passengers
Request all vehicles be preserved at secure storage facility
Send spoliation letters to all parties to preserve evidence
Schedule IME (Independent Medical Exam) if serious injuries claimed
within72Hours: Attend multi-carrier conference call to discuss liability allocation
Review reconstruction report and update liability percentages in system
Negotiate with plaintiff attorneys on any represented claimants
Adjust reserves based on medical specials and wage loss documentation
Prepare coverage position letter if policy limits demand received

documentationRequired: Medical reports for all injured parties
Witness statements from all available witnesses

name: Pedestrian Accident and Personal Injury Protection
description: Comprehensive coverage for incidents involving vehicle-pedestrian collisions, with an extensive protection plan that goes beyond standard liability. The policy includes immediate medical coverage, long-term rehabilitation support, and legal assistance for both the insured driver and the injured pedestrian. Unique provisions cover psychological trauma, potential disability accommodations, and extended medical care, recognizing the complex nature of pedestrian accident aftermath.

immediate: Flag claim as pedestrian injury - high exposure potential in system
Obtain recorded statement from insured driver same day if possible
Set high initial reserves: $200K BI minimum pending medical evaluation
Contact defense counsel from approved panel for immediate consultation
Send litigation hold notice to preserve vehicle ECM and phone records
within24Hours: Order complete medical records package through medical record vendor
Retain biomechanical engineer if speed/impact disputed by police
Conduct scene inspection with digital camera and measurements
Request any available surveillance video from surrounding businesses
Interview witnesses independently using recorded statement form
within72Hours: Retain life care planner if permanent disability suspected
Coordinate with plaintiff counsel on medical bill payment procedures
Request wage loss documentation if pedestrian employed
Update reserves based on treating physician narrative reports
Schedule case management conference with supervisor and legal

documentationRequired: Police accident report with detailed diagram
Witness statements from all available parties
Traffic signal timing and crosswalk documentation

conditions: all pedestrian cases require supervisor review

serious.definition: major fractures, internal injuries, hospitalization required

catastrophic.definition: permanent disability, brain injury, spinal cord damage

name: Mechanical Failure and Road Hazard Incident Coverage
description: A specialized policy addressing accidents caused by sudden mechanical failures or unexpected road hazards. Coverage includes damage resulting from tire blowouts, brake system failures, or collisions triggered by road infrastructure issues. The policy provides comprehensive protection that covers vehicle repairs, potential medical expenses, and assistance with alternative transportation. Claim process requires detailed mechanical inspection, road condition documentation, and expert verification of the incident's root cause.

immediate: Verify comprehensive coverage in force and premium current in system
Obtain recorded statement from insured about maintenance history
Request photos of failed component before any repairs begin
Set conservative reserves pending mechanical inspection results
Check for related manufacturer recalls in NHTSA database
within24Hours: Schedule tear-down inspection with ASE certified mechanic from vendor network
Request maintenance records from all servicing dealers/shops
Contact manufacturer warranty department if vehicle under warranty
Research similar claims in internal database for pattern recognition
Upload photos to engineering consultant for preliminary failure analysis
within72Hours: Review mechanical inspection report for cause determination
Process subrogation referral if manufacturer defect confirmed
Apply appropriate deductible based on coverage cause determination
Issue repair authorization or total loss settlement based on estimate
Close claim file or transfer to subrogation unit if recovery potential exists

documentationRequired: Weather conditions at time of incident
